Returns:

AccelSolrad

public static double[] AccelSolrad(double[] r,
                                   double[] r_Sun,
                                   double Area,
                                   double mass,
                                   double CR,
                                   double P0,
                                   double AU)
Computes the acceleration due to solar radiation pressure assuming the spacecraft surface normal to the Sun direction Note: r, r_sun, Area, mass, P0 and AU must be given in consistent units, e.g. m, m^2, kg and N/m^2.

Parameters:
r - Spacecraft position vector
r_Sun - Sun position vector
Area - Cross-section
mass - Spacecraft mass
CR - Solar radiation pressure coefficient
P0 - Solar radiation pressure at 1 AU
AU - Length of one Astronomical Unit
Returns:
Acceleration (a=d^2r/dt^2)

Illumination

public static double Illumination(double[] r,
                                  double[] r_Sun)
Computes the fractional illumination of a spacecraft in the vicinity of the Earth assuming a cylindrical shadow model

Parameters:
r - Spacecraft position vector [m]
r_Sun - Sun position vector [m]
Returns:
Illumination factor: nu=0 Spacecraft in Earth shadow, nu=1 Spacecraft fully illuminated by the Sun
